required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduction of Post Mastectomy Pain With the Jacki® Recovery Jacket
clinical_study.official_title: Reduction of Post Mastectomy Pain With the Jacki® Recovery Jacket: Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This research study is studying a garment called the Jacki® recovery jacket that can be worn after surgery as a possible way to manage pain from surgical drains.
The study intervention involved in this study is:
-"Jacki" recovery jacket

detailed_description.textblock: In this research study, the investigators are studying the Jacki, a garment that can be worn post-mastectomy with pockets that hold post-surgical drains. The Jacki was invented by a cancer survivor who leads A Little Easier Recovery®, a non-profit organization in Massachusetts, and may help participants manage the pain of post-surgical drains to increase comfort and ease of daily living. The jacket has not previously been tested in a research study. The investigators are hoping to learn whether the jacket is effective in reducing pain and discomfort from the time participants leave the hospital until they return to have their drains removed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity (on the 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale)
primary_outcome.description: Pain Intensity Numeric Scale (0-10)(higher scores = worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.description: 1 item (score range 1-5); higher score = worse outcome
1 item (score range 1-5); higher score = worse outcome
3 items (T score 0-100); higher score = worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: PROMIS Pain Interference Scale - Short Form 8a
secondary_outcome.description: 8 items (T score 0-100); higher score = worse outcome
2 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
5 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
2 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
4 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
2 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
2 items; score range 0-100 (higher score = better outcome)
4 items (score 0-100); higher score = worse outcome
2 items (range 0-100); higher score = better outcome
1 item (range 0-100); higher score = better outcome
1 item (range 0-100); higher score = worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: EORTC QLQ-BR23: Systemic Therapy Side Effects Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: 7 items (range 0-100); higher score = worse outcome
4 items (range 0-100); higher score = worse outcome
3 items (range 0-100); higher score = worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: EORTC QLQ-BR23: Upset by Hair Loss Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: 1 item (range 0-100); higher score = worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Patterns At Home: Average Daily Pain Intensity (Daily Diary)
secondary_outcome.description: Average 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale Rating, for 7 days post-discharge, if at least 5 days reported (T2 diary)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management At Home: Use of Pain Medication (Daily Diary)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant self-report of average daily morphine eqivalent dose taken in first 7 days post-discharge (if at least 5 days reported)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Bra (Daily Diary)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy bra (if at least 5 days reported)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Camisole (Daily Diary)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy camisole (if at least 5 days reported)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Usage of Jacki Recovery Jacket (Daily Diary)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post-discharge that participant wore the Jacki recovery jacket at all; no score is better or worse

arm_group.description: -Standard Care pain medicine/management will be given

Patient will be encouraged to use the Jacki Recovery Jacket at home Patient will be taught how to tuck the drainage tubes in the jacket pocket Patient will be taught how to un-tuck the drainage tubes from jacket pocket Standard care pain medicine/management will be given

intervention.description: An outer jacket that holds surgical drains and allows access for blood draws
Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are ≥ 18 years old.
- Patients who speak and understand English.
- Patients who have had mastectomy with reconstructive surgery in one or both breasts.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-morbid delirium
- Dementia
- Mental illness, or neurocognitive deficit prohibiting informed consent and/or ability to complete study procedures.

results_reference.citation: Berry DL, Blonquist TM, Halpenny B, Hong F, Morrison-Ma SC, McCullough MC, Carelli K, Dominici LS, King TA. The Jacki Jacket after mastectomy with reconstruction: a randomized pilot study. Breast Cancer Res Treat. 2020 Jan;179(2):377-385. doi: 10.1007/s10549-019-05465-9. Epub 2019 Oct 14.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Donna Berry, PhD, RN, FAAN, AOCN

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Pain Intensity (on the 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale)
outcome.description: Pain Intensity Numeric Scale (0-10)(higher scores = worse outcome)
outcome.population: Standard Care arm (n=54): 52 of 54 participants who answered T3 with a PINS score, plus 2 participants who answered for the same day in their T2 diary Jacki+Standard Care arm (n=68): 64 of 64 participants who answered T3 with a PINS score, plus 4 participants who answered for the same day in their T2 diary

outcome.title: Pain Patterns At Home: Average Daily Pain Intensity (Daily Diary)
outcome.description: Average 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale Rating, for 7 days post-discharge, if at least 5 days reported (T2 diary)
outcome.population: 16 in Jacki arm and 21 in Standard Care arm did not return T2 diary; 2 in Standard Care arm returned diary with missing data, for a total of 23 missing this measure in Standard Care arm

group.title: Standard Care
group.description: -Standard Care pain medicine/management will be given Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

group.title: JACKI® RECOVERY JACKET + Standard Care

measure.title: Pain Patterns At Home: Average Daily Pain Intensity (Daily Diary)
measure.description: Average 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale Rating, for 7 days post-discharge, if at least 5 days reported (T2 diary)
measure.population: 16 in Jacki arm and 21 in Standard Care arm did not return T2 diary; 2 in Standard Care arm returned diary with missing data, for a total of 23 missing this measure in Standard Care arm

outcome.title: Pain Management At Home: Use of Pain Medication (Daily Diary)
outcome.description: Participant self-report of average daily morphine eqivalent dose taken in first 7 days post-discharge (if at least 5 days reported)
outcome.population: Participants who returned T2 diary with sufficient information on medication usage to calculate a 7-day average morphine equivalent dose

measure.population: Participants who returned T2 diary with sufficient information on medication usage to calculate a 7-day average morphine equivalent dose

outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy bra (if at least 5 days reported)
outcome.population: Participants who returned a T2 diary with sufficient data on wearing a mastectomy bra to calculate a proportion for the first 7 days post-discharge

measure.title: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Bra (Daily Diary)
measure.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy bra (if at least 5 days reported)
measure.population: Participants who returned a T2 diary with sufficient data on wearing a mastectomy bra to calculate a proportion for the first 7 days post-discharge

outcome.title: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Camisole (Daily Diary)
outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy camisole (if at least 5 days reported)
outcome.population: Participants who returned a T2 diary with sufficient data on wearing a mastectomy camisole to calculate a proportion for the first 7 days post-discharge

group.title: Standard Care
group.description: -Standard Care pain medicine/management will be given Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

group.title: JACKI® RECOVERY JACKET + Standard Care
group.description: Patient will be encouraged to use the Jacki Recovery Jacket at home Patient will be taught how to tuck the drainage tubes in the jacket pocket Patient will be taught how to un-tuck the drainage tubes from jacket pocket Standard care pain medicine/management will be given Jacki Recovery jacket: An outer jacket that holds surgical drains and allows access for blood draws Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

measure.title: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Camisole (Daily Diary)
measure.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post discharge that participant wore a mastectomy camisole (if at least 5 days reported)
measure.population: Participants who returned a T2 diary with sufficient data on wearing a mastectomy camisole to calculate a proportion for the first 7 days post-discharge

outcome.title: Patient-Reported Usage of Jacki Recovery Jacket (Daily Diary)
outcome.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post-discharge that participant wore the Jacki recovery jacket at all; no score is better or worse
outcome.population: Summary measure for participants in the Jacki Recovery Jacket + Standard Care arm only. A proportion score was calculated if the measure was reported for at least 5 of the first 7 days post-discharge. Of 73 participants assigned to this arm, 53 returned a T2 diary, and 49 had sufficient data to calculate a proportion score.

group.title: JACKI® RECOVERY JACKET + Standard Care
group.description: Patient will be encouraged to use the Jacki Recovery Jacket at home Patient will be taught how to tuck the drainage tubes in the jacket pocket Patient will be taught how to un-tuck the drainage tubes from jacket pocket Standard care pain medicine/management will be given Jacki Recovery jacket: An outer jacket that holds surgical drains and allows access for blood draws Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

measure.title: Patient-Reported Usage of Jacki Recovery Jacket (Daily Diary)
measure.description: Self-reported proportion of days in the first 7 days post-discharge that participant wore the Jacki recovery jacket at all; no score is better or worse
measure.population: Summary measure for participants in the Jacki Recovery Jacket + Standard Care arm only. A proportion score was calculated if the measure was reported for at least 5 of the first 7 days post-discharge. Of 73 participants assigned to this arm, 53 returned a T2 diary, and 49 had sufficient data to calculate a proportion score.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected only when the participant was on study (usually 1-6 weeks).
reported_events.desc: Per protocol, adverse events that could reasonably be expected to relate to the NSR device (jacket) included: Dislodging post-surgical drains, possibly resulting in infection Becoming over warm or irritating skin Data were collected by chart review and patient report either verbally to the study coordinator or on the study diary.

group.title: Standard Care
group.description: -Standard Care pain medicine/management will be given Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

group.title: JACKI® RECOVERY JACKET + Standard Care
group.description: Patient will be encouraged to use the Jacki Recovery Jacket at home Patient will be taught how to tuck the drainage tubes in the jacket pocket Patient will be taught how to un-tuck the drainage tubes from jacket pocket Standard care pain medicine/management will be given Jacki Recovery jacket: An outer jacket that holds surgical drains and allows access for blood draws Standard Care Pain medicine/management: Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
